Package edu.cnm.deepdive.crapssimulator.service

Class CrapsRepository

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.crapssimulator.service.CrapsRepository
  • public class CrapsRepository
extends Object
    Encapsulates the Craps simulation engine, and acts as a source of simulation data. In this implementation, the XoShiRo256PlusPlus pseudorandom number generator is used as a source of randomness.

    • Constructor Summary

      CrapsRepository()
      Initializes this instance.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CrapsRepository

        public CrapsRepository()
        Initializes this instance. On completion, the simulation is ready to begin.

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the running state and win/loss tally of this instance.

      • getSnapshots

        public Flowable<Snapshot> getSnapshots()
        Triggers publication of simulation Snapshot data as a Flowable<Snapshot>. Note that this is a "cold" source: no data is published unless there is a subscriber; in fact, the simulation will not run at all without a subscriber.

        A maximum of 128 snapshots (by default) will be buffered: If a subscriber is not able to consume simulation snapshots as fast as they are published, older snapshots will be discarded when the number of unconsumed snapshots exceeds this buffer size.

        Returns:
        Flowable<Snapshot>

      • runFast

        public void runFast​(int roundsPerSnapshot)
        Starts or resumes execution of the simulation in continuous mode, with the specified number of rounds simulated between snapshot publications.
        Parameters:
        roundsPerSnapshot - Number of rounds to be simulated between snapshots.

      • runOnce

        public void runOnce​(int rounds)
        Simulates one batch of rounds, of the specified size.
        Parameters:
        rounds - Number of rounds to be simulated.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Suspends continuous-mode simulation. Note that the simulation will actually stop only when the current batch of rounds has completed; thus, there may be a noticeable lag between invocation of this method and the actual suspension of execution.
